thread.title: Sutton chairman wants dream FA Cup quarter final draw against Manchester United next as he eyes Arsenal upset
thread.title_full: Sutton chairman wants dream FA Cup quarter final draw against Manchester United next as he eyes Arsenal upset

author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Sutton chairman wants dream FA Cup quarter final draw against Manchester United next as he eyes Arsenal upset
text:
Sutton chairman wants dream FA Cup quarter final draw against Manchester United next as he eyes Arsenal upset The non-leaguers incredible journey continues with a fifth round tie against Arsenal Share Sutton United are hoping to continue their FA Cup fairytale with a win over Arsenal (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chairman Bruce Elliott admits Sutton’s historic FA Cup run has been the craziest period in his 50 -year association with the club. 
The non-leaguers incredible journey continues with a fifth round tie against joint-record 12 times holders Arsenal on Monday. 
The National League side have stunned neighbours AFC Wimbledon and then Leeds United to set up their fairytale Gander Green Lane tie against the Gunners. 
It has been non-stop for Elliott and everyone at Sutton especially having been drawn against all three higher league sides at home. Sutton will be in Sunday's draw for the FA Cup quarter-final (Photo: BBC) A trip to Old Trafford next would be the dream scenario for Sutton's chairman (Photo: PA) 
Elliott, who has been involved with Sutton for half a century as a fan and then club official, said: “I don’t think I have known anything like it in all my time here. 
“When we had the Coventry FA Cup game in 1989 I was not quite in the same position personally, but this has been great fun - so many memorable moments, whatever happens on Monday. 
“But it has been hard work. I’m not sure everyone appreciates how many hours work our volunteers have put in. 
“It has been a huge task. As a club we only have three full time people.” (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: PA) (Photo: PA) 
Arsenal and boss Arsene Wenger will arrive under huge pressure after being thrashed 5-1 by Bayern Munich in the Champions League. 
Elliott is daring to dream about heaping more misery on Sutton’s big-name visitors. 
He joked: “What am I going to do on Tuesday? A holiday sounds quite an attractive proposition – but then we could be planning for the quarter final, couldn’t we?!! Or the replay. Read More When is the FA Cup quarter-final draw? Ball numbers and more ahead of the sixth round 
“We shall know the draw because it is on Sunday, which is quite frightening in itself - we will be in the draw for the quarter finals. 
“My dream draw? Old Trafford. I have always had a soft spot for Manchester United. But let’s not carried away! We can’t think about that. We have to keep our feet on the ground.” poll loading Will Sutton United beat Arsenal? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
